===2009===
===2009===
â
{{further|[[2009 Denver Broncos season]]}}In the 2009 NFL Draft the Denver Broncos drafted running back [[Knowshon Moreno]] and linebacker/defensive end [[Robert Ayers]] in the first round. The Broncos led by the new quarterback [[Kyle Orton]], won a thriller season opener against the [[Cincinnati Bengals]] 12-7 with a 87 yard touchdown pass to [[Brandon Stokley]] with only 11 seconds left in the game. The Broncos then won their second fixture against the Cleveland Browns 27-6, the defense recorded 4 sacks, 1 INT and 1 recovered fumble in an inspiring [[performance]]. On Sep 27th, the Broncos beat the Raiders in Oakland 23-3. Their next game was against the [[Dallas Cowboys]], a comeback win 17-10, with a touchdown catch and run made by [[Brandon Marshall]]. They became the best defense in the NFL through four weeks on the basis of points given up. Later the Broncos played against the [[New England Patriots]] at home. The Broncos won 20-17 in overtime by a 41 yard field goal kicked by Matt Prater. The Broncos are now 5-0.
+
{{further|[[2009 Denver Broncos season]]}}In the 2009 NFL Draft the Denver Broncos drafted running back [[Knowshon Moreno]] and linebacker/defensive end [[Robert Ayers]] in the first round. The Broncos led by the new quarterback [[Kyle Orton]], won the season opener against the [[Cincinnati Bengals]] 12-7 with a 87 yard touchdown pass to [[Brandon Stokley]] with only 11 seconds left in the game. The Broncos then won their second fixture against the Cleveland Browns 27-6, the defense recorded 4 sacks, 1 INT and 1 recovered fumble. On September 27, the Broncos beat the [[Oakland Raiders]] in Oakland 23-3. Their next game was against the [[Dallas Cowboys]], a comeback win 17-10, with a touchdown catch and run made by [[Brandon Marshall]]. They became the best defense in the NFL through four weeks on the basis of points given up. Later the Broncos played against the [[New England Patriots]] at home. The Broncos won 20-17 in overtime by a 41 yard field goal kicked by Matt Prater. The Broncos are now 5-0.
